meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) by force or scheming.
meanings.sent1: The new king supplanted the old ruler by force.
meanings.sent2: Technology has supplanted many traditional methods in our daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel supplanted the bird in the nest for a cozy nap.
meanings.sent4: The rising star supplanted the veteran actor in the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The weeds quickly supplanted the flowers in the garden, overtaking their space.

meanings.definition: To replace (someone or something) as better or more effective.
meanings.sent1: The modern machine supplanted the old one for increased efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Healthy eating habits can supplanted unhealthy ones over time.
meanings.sent3: The clever invention supplanted the need for manual labor in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The new software supplanted the need for paper records in the office.
meanings.sent5: The innovative idea supplanted the outdated approach, leading to success.
